The cruell brother A tragedy. As it was presented, at the priuate house, in the Blacke-Fryers: by His Maiesties Seruants. D'Avenant, William, Sir, 1606-1668.
[80] p.
Imprinted by A[ugustine] M[athewes] for Iohn Waterson, and are to bee solde at the signe of the Crowne in Pauls Church-yard, London : 1630.
Dedication signed: VVilliam D'avenant. Printer's name from STC. Signatures: A-K⁴. The first leaf is blank. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

[80] p.
Imprinted by A[ugustine] M[athewes] for Iohn Waterson, and are to bee solde at the signe of the Crowne in Pauls Church-yard, London : 1630.
Dedication signed: VVilliam D'avenant. Printer's name from STC. Signatures: A-K⁴. The first leaf is blank. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
